March 3, 1967
Mrs. Marjorie Newman
Program Director, WFSU-FM
University Broadcasting Services
The Florida State University
Tallahassee, Florida 32306
Dear Mrs. Newman:
Thank you for your letter of February 22 in support of legislation
to renew the ETV Facilities Act. I was sorry to hear that you were
unable to attend the recent meeting of the Board of Directors of
National Educational Radio here in Washington due to your broken
leg.
I am enclosing a copy of the President’s Message to Congress
entitled "Health and Education" which sets forth his recommenda¬
tions on educational television and radio along with a copy of
S. 1160, Public Television Act of 1967, which was introduced by
Senator Magnuson on March 2. Briefly, this bill provides:.
(l) extend and improve the program of grants for construction of
noncommercial educational radio broadcasting facilities; (2) establish
and finance a nonprofit corporation to assist program operations in
noncommercial educational television and radio; and (3) to authorize
a study of instructional television and its relationship to educa¬
tional television.
I am in general accord with your thinking on this matter and am
hopeful that the bill will be reported by the Committee on Com¬
merce in such form that I can support it. The Committee advises
that no hearings have yet been scheduled,'however, I shall follow
developments closely, keeping your interest in mind.
With best wishes
I remain
